solution_line_template: Ann and Becky have worked for {ann_hours} hours each, so both of them worked for {num_full_shift_workers} people * {ann_hours} hours/person = <<{num_full_shift_workers}*{ann_hours}={total_full_shift_hours}>>{total_full_shift_hours} hours.
All three of them, including Julia, were working for {total_full_shift_hours} hours + {julia_hours} hours = {total_hours} hours.
So in total, they all have served {customers_per_hour} customers/hour * {total_hours} hours = <<{customers_per_hour}*{total_hours}={total_customers}>>{total_customers} customers in one day.
